description: How to report crime or antisocial behaviour on public transport in London

{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Emergencies"}
In an emergency:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Call the police on\u003cstrong\u003e999\u003c/strong\u003e ","Speak to the nearest member of staff","Use the passenger alarm"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Reporting a crime"}
To report a crime on the transport network:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Call the police on\u003cstrong\u003e101\u003c/strong\u003e ","For Tube and rail, you can also text what happened, where and when, to 61016","Also, you can \u003ca href=\"https://online.met.police.uk/\"\u003ereport some crimes - such as theft, criminal damage and hate crime - online\u003c/a\u003e "]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Terrorism or suspicious activity"}
To report possible terrorist activity:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Call the confidential hotline on\u003cstrong\u003e0800 789 321\u003c/strong\u003e ","Report online to the \u003ca href=\"https://beta.met.police.uk/tell-us-about/possible-terrorist-activity/\"\u003eMet Police\u003c/a\u003e ","Give information anonymously via \u003ca href=\"https://crimestoppers-uk.org/\"\u003eCrimeStoppers\u003c/a\u003e "]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Hate crime"}
A hate crime is defined by the British Transport Police as when someone commits a crime against you because of your:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["race","religion","sexual orientation","gender identity","disability"]}

We understand that you might not feel comfortable talking to the police about what happened.
You can submit reports anonymously via True Vision - Report It .
In addition, you can report hate crime to some of the organisations who support affected communities, including:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":[" \u003ca href=\"https://www.stophateuk.org/\"\u003eStop Hate UK\u003c/a\u003e , for all hate crime"," \u003ca href=\"https://tellmamauk.org\"\u003eTell MAMA\u003c/a\u003e , for anti-Muslim hate crime"," \u003ca href=\"https://cst.org.uk/\"\u003eCommunity Security Trust\u003c/a\u003e , for anti-Semitic hate crime"," \u003ca href=\"http://www.galop.org.uk/\"\u003eGALOP\u003c/a\u003e , for anti-LGBT+ hate crime"]}

Find out more about how to report hate crime. Remember, you don't have to be the victim of hate crime to report it. You can report anything you've seen happening to someone else, or report it on their behalf if they don't want to.

{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"CCTV evidence"}

It's important that you report a crime or incident on the transport system as soon as possible. Images captured by CCTV are only kept for a limited time period. Find out more about how long we keep personal data .
